title: Janna...
body:
So with the rise of assassins Janna feels more satisfying to play now and believe me I was already satisfied in the first place. Which leaves me to my main concern which would be the tweaking of Janna possibly the nerfs that may come as she will be a more contested pick due to her countering every assassin that set foot into league. So now that I'm done I want to know what riot thinks of her state is she balanced strong or too strong? And also what the community thinks about her balance state.

Sincerely support main

replies.body:
The fact that {{champion:40}} maintains the highest win rate of any support (54%) even after that very punishing Q instant-cast range nerf in patch 5.17 says a lot. She's incredibly safe and her utility is always invaluable.

Even with all the engage/pick items being built right now ({{item:3009}}{{item:3025}}{{item:3742}}{{item:3092}}) Janna is still able to bring safety/lifesaving peel. This will only increase with the influx of assassins.

She's my favorite. And she's pretty strong.  Very strong?  Basically. If you want to win, you play {{champion:40}}. But this has always been true.

I think Janna's in a fine spot. She consistently has a high winrate, but I think that's because 1. she's relatively easy to pick up, but also has a high ceiling for mastery, and 2. she has a well-defined niche, but that niche just so happens to counter a lot of popular champions. I think Riot is more likely to focus on balancing assassins, rather than focusing on Janna; I don't think Riot's trying to enforce an assassin meta right now, it's just that assassins are undergoing changes and thus are going to be unbalanced for a while. I also don't think it's likely that Riot will nerf a counter champion who has a well defined niche/is otherwise pretty healthy. When ADCs had the class update, armor stacking tanks such as Malphite and Rammus took off in winrate, but I don't recall them really getting nerfs.
She's good at what she does.  Don't take that away from her, they already took scaling away from her and nerfed her slow cd.

Of course you were already satisfied. She leaves you breathless.

Janna's kit is very hard to nerf. Her auto range is really short, her insta Q is the weakest it's been in years and her ultimate is an AOE instant knock back. You can tweak all the numbers you want, it's going to be strong regardless.

Janna's main issue is just how safe she herself is. In that regard, her base armor, health per level, or the AP scaling on her MS all seem like easy nerf targets.
